channel.title: The Joystiq Podcast
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 Weblogs, Inc. The contents of this feed are available for non-commercial use only.
channel.itunes:title: The Joystiq Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Joystiq
channel.itunes:summary: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from the Internet that all the ears should be rocked with video game podcasts. And all went to be rocked, every one into his own iTunes account. And Chris Grant also went up unto the city to be taxed with Ludwig Kietzmann, his espoused co-host, being great with child. And so it was, that, while they were there he should be delivered. And he brought forth their firstborn podcast, and wrapped it in swaddling jokes, and laid it in a Zune; because there was no room for them in the iPod. And there were in the same country gamers abiding in the field, keeping watch over their ... games by night. And, lo, the angel who was named Justin McElroy came upon them, and the glory of video games shone round about them: and they were sore afraid. And the angel said unto them, "Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people. For unto you is born this day a savior, which is the Joystiq Podcast."

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 010: EVO 2012, The Secret World, Dyad, Ouya
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast knows no bounds.

First up, Xav, JC, and Richard are hitting the big games of the week. JC gets psychedelic with Dyad, Richard talks about his surprisingly enjoyable time in The Secret World, and Xav jumps into the heated competition of Counter-Strike: Global Offensive and the indie survival game Project Zomboid.

In the second segment, Dave and Jordan are joined by freelancer Heidi Kemps to discuss the biggest fighting game tournament of the year, EVO 2012. After a quick check-in with Jess from Comic-Con, it's news time with Ben, Ludwig, and Dave hitting the Ouya, Steam Summer Sale, Epic's Fortnite on Unreal Engine 4, and more.

Be sure to check after the break to see how you can snag yourself one of five codes for Dyad on PSN.

Listen to the Super Joystiq Podcast:
  • Subscribe to the Super Joystiq Podcast in iTunes
  • Super Joystiq Podcast is also available in the Zune Marketplace
  • Add the Super Joystiq Podcast feed to your RSS aggregator
  • Download the MP3 directly
A stream of the show and details about each segment is available after the break.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 009: Theatrhythm Final Fantasy, Spelunky, Gaikai
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast goes off on a few hilarious tangents.

It's a two segment show this week. In the first segment, Xav, Ludwig, JC, and Richard discuss the oddity that is Theatrhythm Final Fantasy, the soul crushing Spelunky, the hilarity of Penny Arcade's On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness 3, and the maybe not so Amazing Spider-Man. But only after the guys talk about Metroid Prime and Brute Force.

Ben helms news this week alongside two Mikes (Schramm and Suszek) and a Jess. Sony kicks things off in a big way by acquiring streaming games company Gaikai. Also on tap: $99 future consoles (maybe), HD re-releases, and fake British accents.

Be sure to check after the break to see if you snagged yourself one of five one-year PlayStation Plus subscription codes.

Listen to the Super Joystiq Podcast:

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 008: Skyrim Dawnguard, Spec Ops - The Line, Quantum Conundrum
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast crosses the line.

In the first segment, Xav, Ludwig, and Ben discuss Spec Ops: The Line and the first big DLC add-on for Skyrim, Dawnguard. For more on Spec Ops: The Line, don't miss the Super Joystiq Podcast Special from earlier this week.

The Joystiq Research Institute returns with an examination of Quantum Conundrum. The Joystream was back in action for this one, so make sure to check out the playthrough with Xav, Jess, and Richard after the break. News closes the show with Alexander, Jordan, JC, and Mike Schramm hitting the biggest stories from the week.

There's also a new giveaway this week. Listen to the show for your chance to win one of five PlayStation Plus 1-year subscription codes!

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast Special: 'Spec Ops - The Line' lead designer Cory Davis
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

In a special edition of the Super Joystiq Podcast, editor-in-chief Ludwig Kietzmann speaks with Cory Davis, lead designer of the Yager-developed shooter Spec Ops: The Line.

After being seemingly stuck in development for years following its 2009 announcement, the team at Yager Development has finally shipped the third-person shooter. Taking place in a sandstorm ravaged Dubai, the game centers on a Delta Force team sent into the region to locate their own missing personnel.

Spec Ops: The Line is available today for the PC, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3.

Listen to the Super Joystiq Podcast:

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 007: Steel Battalion, SpyParty, Diablo 3 patches, Microsoft's Surface
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast gets tense.

In the first segment, Xav, JC, Richard, and Mike Schramm discuss Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor and the Metal Gear HD Collection for Vita. They also get into some deep discussion about the recent changes to Diablo 3.

The Joystiq Research Institute returns with Jess, Ben, and Xav playing through SpyParty. The crew even streamed the game on our new Twitch.TV account. (Watch the session after the break, and please forgive the technical issues!) To wrap up another full episode, Alex, Ludwig and Mike Suszek examine the latest industry news.

We're also continuing our giveaway from last week. Listen to the show for your chance to win one of three Awesomenauts soundtracks on vinyl.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 006: Gears of War: Judgment, E3 2012 take-aways, '38 Spouse'
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast is all about E3 2012.

Xav, JC, and Richard discuss E3, starting with Watch Dogs. Richard is back to check in with Jess and Jordan to see how their first E3 experience went. In news, Alexander, Ben, and Dave tackle the latest industry buzz, including the continuing 38 Studios saga, Dave's time with Gears of War: Judgment, and more.

There's also a new giveaway this week. Listen to the show for your chance to win one of three Awesomenauts soundtracks on vinyl.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast Special: E3 2012 'Day 3'
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

In our final Super Joystiq Podcast E3 Special, we gather round the microphone to chat about the Wii U (ZombiU in particular), Persona 4 Arena, Pid, The Testament of Sherlock Holmes, Dead Space 3 ... and a little more XCOM: Enemy Unknown.

We've still got plenty more content on the way, so stay tuned to Joystiq for even more E3 goodness over the next few days.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast Special: E3 2012 'Day 0'
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

Xav, Alexander, Ben, and Mike Schramm discuss 'Day Zero' of E3 2012, which was filled with press conferences from Microsoft, EA, Ubisoft, and Sony.

The team discusses surprises, like Ubisoft's Splinter Cell: Blacklist and Watch Dogs, Microsoft's Halo 4, and EA's Need for Speed: Most Wanted.

Joystiq will have new Super Joystiq Special episodes every day this week. Keep it locked! And stay up-to-date with everything during E3 with our brand new E3 2012 Event Landing Page.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast Special: 'E3 2012 Pre-show' - Microsoft, Sony, and Wii U announcements
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

It's the evening before Microsoft, Sony, and a number of other companies take the stage for Pre-E3 media briefings.

Xav, JC, Richard, and Mike Schramm discuss what we can expect from tomorrow's E3 2012 "Day Zero," react to Nintendo's recent Wii U announcements, and ask what Rare is up to these days.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 005: E3 predictions and rookie editor's guide, Resistance Burning Skies
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

This week's Super Joystiq Podcast focuses on the industry's upcoming big show: E3 2012. It's next week!

Before Xav, Ludwig, and JC discuss E3, we find out why Resistance: Burning Skies fails for the Vita. Richard helps assuage the fears of Jordan and Jess, who are a little nervous about covering (and going to) E3 for the first time in their careers. In news, Alexander and Ben tackle the latest industry buzz, including the Silicon Knights vs. Epic legal issues, pre-E3 leaks, and more.

There's also a new giveaway this week. Listen to the show for your chance to win a download code for Blizzard's Diablo 3.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 004: 38 Studios meltdown, Gravity Rush, Civilization 5: Gods & Kings, Dragon's Dogma
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

There's a lot to cover this week, so think of each segment as vignettes about great games and industry culture.

This week Xav, JC, and Alexander discuss Gravity Rush, Civilization 5: Gods & Kings, the craziness that is Tropico 4, and a little Diablo 3 and Ghost Recon: Future Soldier peppered in for good measure.

Review round table returns with Jordan discussing Dragon's Dogma with freelancer Heidi Kemps and Polygon's Phil Kollar. Joystiq Research Institute welcomes the latest member of the site's editorial staff, Mike Suszek, along with Jess and Mike Schramm to discuss the indie point-and-click adventure The Journey Down.

Alex, Ben, and Jess bring you the latest industry news, including the entire 38 Studios meltdown. And to wrap it all up, Xav, JC, and Ludwig pull questions from the Joystiq Mailbag.

Winners for our Awesomenauts and Diablo 3: Collector's Edition are revealed in this episode, as well as details on a new giveaway for some PlayStation Vita accessories and a copy of Lumines: Electronic Symphony.

Listen to the Super Joystiq Podcast:
  • Subscribe to the Super Joystiq Podcast in iTunes
  • Super Joystiq Podcast is also available in the Zune Marketplace
  • Add the Super Joystiq Podcast feed to your RSS aggregator

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 003: The Last Of Us, Diablo 3, Torchlight 2 Beta, E3 Judge's Week
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

The Super Joystiq Podcast goes to hell and back in another packed episode.

In the Previews segment, Xav and Ludwig discuss E3 Judge's Week, new details on The Last of Us, Max Payne 3 single-player, Infinity Blade: Dungeons, and more; Mike and Richard discuss their experiences with Diablo 3 and the Torchlight 2 beta in a new segment of Debate Club; Jess, Jordan, and Dave play Offspring Fling in a new approach to the Joystiq Research Institute (We've added Science!); and Alexander, JC, and Ben discuss this week's biggest news, including the 38 Studios debacle, Activision's legal issues, and THQ's financial woes.

Stay tuned to the end of the show to find out how you can win a copy of the Diablo 3: Collector's Edition! (Some rules and conditions apply, see after the break for details.) Also, make sure to follow the new @JoystiqPodcast Twitter feed for your shot at Torchlight 2 beta codes!

We told you this show would be Super.

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 002: Max Payne 3, Starhawk, Minecraft, Street Fighter vs. Mortal Kombat
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

The Super Joystiq Podcast returns with another packed show!

After discussing how The Avengers as a film relates to blockbuster gaming, Xav, Ludwig, and Richard discuss Max Payne 3 multiplayer, Starhawk, and Hitman Absolution: Sniper Challenge in the WRUP and Previews segement. Jess and Ben discuss Minecraft's XBLA debut in the Joystiq Research Institute, while Dave and Jordan argue about Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat in our first-ever 'Debate Club' segment. The episode wraps up with Alex, JC, and Mike providing you with the latest industry news.

Also, our Awesomenauts giveaway continues until next week. You can still enter to win one of five XBLA codes for the game!

item.title: Super Joystiq Podcast 001: Black Ops 2, Elder Scrolls Online, The Walking Dead
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

Welcome to our new show, the Super Joystiq Podcast! We've shed our previous format and have gone back to what fans of the original Joystiq Podcast said they loved: WRUP, news, and best of all, conversations about the industry's biggest topics from the entire Joystiq editorial team.

This week, Xav and Ludwig discuss Black Ops 2 and Dishonored; JC leaves a very angry voice mail; Jess, Jordan, and Richard have a spoiler-filled discussion about The Walking Dead in the first installment of the Joystiq Research Institute; Mike talks about using the 3DS to explore the Louvre; and Alex, Dave, and Ben discuss the latest industry news, including The Elder Scrolls Online.

We also have five XBLA codes for Awesomenauts to give away. Listen to the end of the show to find out how you can win!

Listen to the Super Joystiq Podcast:
  • Subscribe to the Super Joystiq Podcast in iTunes
  • Super Joystiq Podcast is also available in the Zune Marketplace
  • Add the Super Joystiq Podcast feed to your RSS aggregator
  • Download the MP3 directly

item.title: The Joystiq Show: Live at PAX East 2012
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

PAX East wrapped this week and Joystiq was at the show in full force. If you weren't able to make it to the expo, fear not: we have the whole Joystiq Live panel right here for you in audio form (though the quality is what you'd expect from a live panel!).

Hear stories of joy and heartache as the Joystiq crew discusses their best and worst picks from the show, stolen personal effects, exciting new site content on the way, and the new direction for this very show.

Also, if you somehow missed it, Jeff Cannata is helming the return of With a Q in video form. Can you handle this much excitement? (Watch the videos from PAX East after the break!)

item.title: The Joystiq Show - 029: Ken Levine and Tim Schafer
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

The Joystiq Show is charting a new course, and this week we take a first step towards a totally revamped show.

First up is an interview with Ken Levine of Irrational Games on BioShock Infinite. Xav and Levine talk storytelling, game mechanics, Irrational's plans for BioShock on PlayStation Vita, and the relief of finally getting a release date.

In part two, Ludwig talks with Tim Schafer of Double Fine about the roller coaster ride of its goal-smashing Kickstarter campaign, and the unexpected work that comes with such a large number of backers. Schafer also plays off his alleged recent proclivity for gigantic gold watches and custom-tailored suits.

Also, don't forget, The Joystiq Show will be live at PAX East on April 7 at 3pm in the Manticore Theatre.

Part 1 (1:36) - Ken Levine interview
Part 2 (28:37) - Tim Schafer interview

Get the podcast:

Guests: Ken Levine (@IGLevine) - Creative Director and Co-Founder, Irrational Games, and Tim Schafer (@TimOfLegend) - President / CEO, Double Fine Productions

item.title: The Joystiq Show - 028: Street Fighter X Jenova
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

Richard, Alexander and Jordan are back in the first segment this week, and while it is technically the "news segment," you might not know it with 30 minutes of Street Fighter X Tekken talk up front. After Jordan says his piece, it really is on to the news.

Classics are being resurrected with Diablo 3 finally getting a release date, and Baldur's Gate (I and II) are coming back in enhanced editions. Battlefield 3 is finally getting some more content, XBLA achievements are getting rejiggered, and Richard talks about his thoughts on Silent Hill: Downpour.

Part 2 is another interview this week as Richard and Jordan sit down with thatgamecompany's Jenova Chen to discuss Journey, his studio, and much more.

Part 1 (1:02) - Street Fighter X Tekken review and the news
Part 2 (59:30) - Journey interview

Get the podcast:
[iTunes] Subscribe to the Joystiq Podcast in iTunes
[Zune] Subscribe to the Joystiq Podcast directly in the Zune Marketplace
[RSS] Add the Joystiq Podcast feed to your RSS aggregator
[MP3] Download the MP3 directly

Host: Richard Mitchell (@TheRichardM)
Guest: Jenova Chen (@JenovaChen) - Co-founder, thatgamecompany
Producer: Jonathan Downin (@jonathandownin - Game Thing Daily)
Production Coordinator: Richard Mitchell
Music: Trash80, Broke for Free and a selection from Silent Hill 2.

View the news topics and stream the show after the break.

item.title: The Joystiq Show - GDC 2012: Day 3
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

GDC 2012 soldiers on. Xav, Alexander, and Ben convene to talk about the third day of the show after sitting in on a few panels, starting with Ben's impressions of a talk from Capcom's Keiji Inafune. Alexander saw Civilization V: Gods & Kings and Sins of a Dark Age, and Xav provides some insight into Quantic Dreams and David Cage's Kara tech demo.

The podcast continues tomorrow, so be sure to check back for your daily GDC 2012 updates.

Part 1 (0:12) - GDC day 3

item.title: The Joystiq Show - GDC 2012: Day 2 (and Mass Effect 3!)
item.description:
Filed under: Podcasts

Oh, you want more video game news and opinion, straight from the Joystiq crew at GDC 2012? How about almost a full hour of that?

Xav, Ludwig and JC sit down for a lengthy discussion on pizza, Lollipop Chainsaw, The Witcher 2 for Xbox 360, the reveal of SimCity, and Mass Effect 3. If you're not at GDC, enjoy the luxury of being able to play Mass Effect 3 at a leisurely pace -- we hear it's pretty good.

Part 1 (0:12) - GDC day 2
